docs.snippet: A 1987 lawsuit against the N.C.A.A. underscores the difficulty of litigating claims of antitrust violations that the governor of Pennsylvania has recently made over Penn State’s sanctions....
docs.lead_paragraph: A 1987 lawsuit against the N.C.A.A. underscores the difficulty of litigating claims of antitrust violations that the governor of Pennsylvania has recently made over Penn State’s sanctions.
docs.abstract: Several lawsuits against NCAA are now being recalled after Gov Tom Corbett of Pennsylvania announced that he was suing organization on behalf of the state; he is alleging that NCAA committed antitrust violations through the penalties it levied on Penn State after the Jerry Sandusky child sexual abuse scandal; 1987 lawsuit by Southern Methodist University underscores difficulty of litigating claims of antitrust violations.

headline.seo: S.M.U. Case Suggests Hard Road for Corbett’s Penn State Suit
headline.main: Old Case Suggests Hard Road for a Governor’s Suit
headline.print_headline: Old Case Suggests a Hard Road for a Governor’s Suit Against the N.C.A.A.

docs.snippet: Gov. Tom Corbett took a misguided step when he sued the N.C.A.A. for the sanctions it imposed on Penn State....
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Tom Corbett took a misguided step when he sued the N.C.A.A. for the sanctions it imposed on Penn State.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Pennsylvania Gov Tom Corbett for filing federal lawsuit to force NCAA to revoke highly deserved sanctions imposed on Penn State and its football program for child rape scandal and cover-up involving former assistant coach Jerry Sandusky.

docs.snippet: Jerry Tarkanian’s legacy is often seen in terms of his battles with the N.C.A.A., but his coaching methods hardly seem out of place today....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jerry Tarkanian’s legacy is often seen in terms of his battles with the N.C.A.A., but his coaching methods hardly seem out of place today.
docs.abstract: Profile of Jerry Tarkanian, whose legacy is often seen in terms of his battles with the NCAA; his methods, once thought unusual, were made famous at UNLV and he won more than 700 games, earned a national championship and went to four Final Fours, before retiring in 2002.

headline.seo: College Basketball Catches Up to Jerry Tarkanian
